channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description:
@RottenInDenmark @deonteleologist But he accepts the Republican idea that “racism” is only explicit racial discrimination or *false* judgements based on race. And he thinks his phrenology consists of *true* judgements so is not racist.
@RottenInDenmark @deonteleologist My Beloved Conservative Relative who believed all the Obama conspiracy theories couldn’t understand why his liberal friends considered him racist. He was really hurt and puzzled by that.
Not a surprise: My congressman has come to the defense of crypto scammers and declined to respond to press inquiries. https://t.co/sTFHxHFtAj
In a world much like our own, HUC’s Cincinnati campus prospers due to its good rail connections to nearby Philadelphia and Baltimore. https://t.co/4J0Wd082d1

@azforeman I have always wondered why Amtrak doesn’t have a Saint Louis stop between DC and Norfolk.
@azforeman Also, I like how the Mediterranean tunnel departs from Jerusalem, where lesser engineers might have chosen Tel Aviv.
Three miles from the house where my mother grew up. https://t.co/DLEaqmaxIy
A really important point at the present moment. https://t.co/KJcHNE1PmQ
If you had told my 12 year old self that somewhere there was a 3 year old who would grow up to play Captain Pike, my mind would have been totally blown. https://t.co/Sh6XrYOLPy
Really, the one simple trick that makes for non-hurried seders. https://t.co/brbePL0zpM
@MisfitTorah That’s why they preemptively invested in calling her dumb. Because she might convince their followers that they’re being played for suckers.
@ZachWeiner Counterpoint, immediately above you in my timeline: https://t.co/pVZhmXEjcT
Pictured: Pinochet, the Free Market Parrot. https://t.co/LmuaHcyFpw
@CharlesBHallPhD Just spoke to someone who, because of the vagaries of US-Israel travel, ended up getting five shots. Her pre-travel testing two weeks ago revealed she was nonetheless infected.
@kithrup @cstross Yes, but more prone to being shuffled when dropped.

It is possible that I saw the Gumby episode cited here when it first aired. I was four at the time and I loved Gumby. https://t.co/bqiFaCojGy
If so, it might had been my first exposure to typesetting equipment and computer keyboards. (My dad had a typewriter, and would occasionally bring home surplus punch cards from his dissertation work, which was a FORTRAN linear programming project.)
One wonders about the impact of shows watched and forgotten in childhood.
@AvBronstein Drones and cyber. The rabbinate needs more drones and cyber.

@JewishWonk Alternate history is a thing. As is Jewish alternate history.
@JewishWonk Stay tuned for Other Covenants. https://t.co/wmPjtWbPfS
@onthemainline Dovid Z Hoffman would know of 19th century sin!
@onthemainline And people say romance novels aren’t realistic….
@EladNehorai You didn’t get the memo? Apparently cancel culture isn’t cancel culture when it’s done by frummies, in which case it’s a good thing. https://t.co/YxgMj75wBT
@christapeterso Forget the husband. How are the dead duck’s family going to feel when they read that post?
@SER1897 @onthemainline Gay marriage wasn’t a threat to straight marriage, but one suspects it severely harmed the grade school bully lifestyle. Which is what all the backlash is really about.
@Nick_Pettigrew @VonHitchofen Nothing personal, but I had to verify this for myself. It checks out. https://t.co/v5czKgaNG2
@kithrup @cstross Call me old fashioned, but I have to disagree. Less vulnerable to demagnetization.
Stick a candleholder on each crew member’s head and you have a Hanukkah menorah. Just sayin’. https://t.co/tw4c3iceR3
